sentences: REQ ID: 112677 JOB TITLE: On Board Software Developer SALARY: £39,200 - £51,800 LOCATION: Gaydon - Hybrid  We’re re-examining our vehicles and what a vehicle means in the emerging world of automation, connectedness, electrification and the shared economy
New ideas, new technology, and new approaches to mobility are our business
Join a team of next generation thinkers
What to Expect
The role is that of a Lead software developer for embedded diagnostic platform creation for automotive applications
The main purpose of this role is for the development of software sub systems elements into vehicle programmes

The individual will work within an Agile framework with engineers to ensure that valid content is specified, developed and arrange verification activity to support the Vehicle Health Management applications which meets best software programming practices for quality, cost and time
Project activities can comprehend:

Development of JLR’S future embedded software components aimed at delivering modern luxury to our customers through Vehicle Health Management, some examples include Vehicle Event Resolution Engine, Vehicle Diagnostics and Signal handlers
Contribute towards Low Level Design of new features into core software components
Development of new features for existing components, delivering work in an Agile environment
Join Scaled Agile Framework (SAFe) PI planning and Scrum ceremonies
Key performance indicators:
Throughput will be measured primarily using story points in JIRA as part of delivering Agile sprints
Discovery and implemented code created using approved JLR digital toolsets and industry standards
Ensuring all authored is:
Stable – Should results in zero downtime or issues
Testable – Codebase should have a high 95%+ code coverage
Reducing Code Churn – Minimise the amount of code rework sprint on sprint
Supporting the Team – Reducing Silo by ensure that 10-20% of time is spent working with others e
g
KT sessions, Code reviews etc
Partner with developers and tech leads across the enterprise to identify business needs and appropriate technical solutions
Key Accountabilities and Responsibilities:
Work as a technical leader for the delivery of the system or software being developed to meet the business requirements on time with appropriate quality and at the right cost

A typical day for a software developer in JLR requires a mix of technical knowledge in C/C++, experience with Linux and Hardware, CI/CD activities and different integration activities with 3rd parties and proprietary solutions
Implementing code and documenting of technical solutions from low-level design artefacts using recognised repositories, processes and coding practices
Software development discovery for automotive diagnostic applications, working alongside other developers and architects to resolve complex coding problems
Knowledge Skills and Experience:
Essential:
Technically capable of defining, developing, and maintaining full software (OOP)
Programming and scripting languages (C++, C, Python, Bash)
Champion of technology excellence by coaching, mentoring, guiding, leading by example
Knowledge of software structures / architectures / design patterns
Knowledge of DevOps (Gitlab CI/CD, Docker)
Knowledge of agile frameworks (SCRUM, Kanban)
Knowledge of Embedded operating systems (Linux, QNX Neutrino, etc)
Desirable:
Knowledge of Automotive diagnostics testers
Knowledge of automotive and consumer networks
Fundamental knowledge of electronics hardware platforms
Knowledge of hardware from silicon (processor, memory etc)
Knowledge of ASPICE, V-Model and regulated environments
SO WHY US?

Bring all this to the home of premium innovation, and you’ll find the opportunities to further your career with a world-class team, a discounted car purchase and lease scheme for you and your family, membership of a competitive pension plan and performance related bonus scheme
All this and more makes Jaguar Land Rover the perfect place to continue your journey
This role may offer the opportunity for hybrid working where you can split your time between working from home and in the office
At Jaguar Land Rover, hybrid working is a voluntary, non-contractual arrangement providing employees with more choice and flexibility around how, when and where they work, if suitable for their role
Further details can be discussed with the Hiring Manager at interview stage
Please be aware that we may close this vacancy for applications before the stated deadline if we receive a high volume of interest
We strongly advise you to submit your application as early as possible
Jaguar Land Rover is committed to equal opportunity for all
